website_summaries.verdict: Overall, the Skechers GOrun Ride 7 has made a lot of purchasers happy and contented because of its design and performance. Aside from its construction, the shoe also provides the right amount of cushioning that is needed on a wide variety of paved surfaces. Although several of them have issues with its price and size, others still recommend the Skechers GOrun Ride 7 because of its quality. It is a good option for those who are looking for a breathable, comfortable, responsive and versatile running shoe.
pros: A good number of buyers noticed that the Skechers GOrun Ride 7 was a versatile running shoe
According to several runners, the shoe has an excellent lacing system
A few purchasers lauded its responsiveness
A lot of testers said that the shoe was comfortable
Many purchasers commented that the Skechers GOrun Ride 7 has an excellent cushioning
Various consumers said that the shoe was stylish
A good number of testers said that the shoe was breathable
The majority of the reviewers agreed that the shoe has a well-constructed knit upper
The length of the shoe was lightweight, based on observations
The Skechers GOrun Ride 7 have many color options to choose from
cons: Based on some reviews, the shoe was expensive
Several buyers said that the Skechers GOrun Ride 7 runs small

customer_reviews.title: They are the real running shoes, don’t let the name fool you
customer_reviews.text: One of the best running shoes that I have run in a long time, 30+ miles a week runner who run in the 22:00’s for 5K and have been running for more than 40 years. Ran 10 miles in them yesterday with zero issues from the shoes on only my third run in them. Highly recommmended.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Shaw

customer_reviews.title: One of the best running shoes from 2017/2018.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent running shoe at an amazing price. Someone incredibly cushioned yet very responsive. Rolls through your stride with ease. My only issue with this shoe is instability. I sometimes need a little more support in a shoe (not necessarily a stability shoe, but just a neutral shoe with more structure and stability in cushion and midsole/outsole), and the Ride 7 can get a little wobbly, particularly late in runs when I'm tired and fatigued. Those issues are my own though, and if you have a nice solidly neutral gait cycle be sure to give these a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Tico J. Punk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing running shoe
customer_reviews.text: 5 miles a day for months now. These shoes are even great for fat boys. I was 245, down to 204. The shoes carried me there. On my second pair of these, hopefully they will take me to 180 or 170. I run on asphalt running trail and cement sidewalks. They aren't the most cushioned, but they are very lightweight, and yet my knees have no paid from running in them. The insoles and the tread wear at a pretty solid even rate. Sneakers are like tires, they only last so many hundreds of miles. But I pushed these shoes far past their usage point and they kept going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Book of Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Not your kids sketchers- look Mom no lights
customer_reviews.text: Forget about the light up and velcro Sketchers that you got your kids and do yourself a favor and try these on. The uppers are stretchy and comfortable. The cushioning is very nice. Not Hoka Clifton 1 soft but nice and soft with support. I am a bigger guy and I am hard on shoes. These have provided the cushioning and support I need. Other shoes I like are Fresh Foam Beacon, Hoka Clifton, and Nike Epic and Odesy (don't like heal cup) The difference is $$$$$ The Sketchers are just so much more affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: ... of late in that I have been nursing a bad case of plantar faciatis for some time
customer_reviews.text: I have been a recent fan of sketchers walk shoes as of late in that I have been nursing a bad case of plantar faciatis for some time. The soles provide a very decent amount and of cushioning that makes my feet feel like they are on a cloud. Especially compared to my usual running shoe brand I wore for over 10 years. I find these shoes to run on the small side but offer great support. I just wish sketchers were more consistent in size from shoe to shoe much less style to style
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try these as daily walkers for the extra cushioning as I am rehabbing an achilles tendon from running. Ordered a size 13, received what the label says is a 13 but they are WAY small. Strange because I have a couple of other pairs of Sketchers that have all been the right fit with size 13. Maybe the model of shoe? Order a size, maybe a size and a half larger.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Bruch

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye heel pain!
customer_reviews.text: I've recently had severe heel pain due to plantar fasciitis and even my favorite pair of New Balance sneakers wasn't helping. After some research I heard these sneakers had the most cushioning and they weren't lying. These sneakers were so comfortable I barely had any pain while wearing them. I would say 95% of the pain from my heel was controlled by these magic wonders. I'm going to buy another two pairs just in case they discontinue them. If you have any kind of foot pain I suggest you give these a try.
customer_reviews.author: Xamian

customer_reviews.title: Light and cushy
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing GoRun Rides since v3. They get better every year. These are the most cushioned of previous versions. They fit a little tight at first but stretch out after wearing. Because of hip issues, I wouldn't be running if not for these shoes. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for running and exercising. I normally wear size 8, but reading reviews that these come in smaller, I ordered 8.5, but they are still a bit tight for me. I should have be bought 9 instead. Overall these are good shoes that protect me from the pounding on the pavement, but I also added Dr Schulz insoles for extra comfort. Good shoes but they need to do a better job with sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt Friday

customer_reviews.title: Feel both fast and soft.
customer_reviews.text: The GoRun Ride 7 have been outstanding for the first couple runs. I’ve been wearing Altra Torin for a while and these feel a bit faster and just as soft. I’ve done a 5 and 6 mile run without any noticeable discomfort. I felt a little heel slip on the first run but was able to lock it in on the second run. I’m coming off a foot injury so I won’t be doing any 10-12 mile runs for a few weeks but I’m looking forward to seeing how they perform. You’ll know if they performed well because you won’t be able to find any size 10 on Amazon anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really a great running shoe. It has alot of memory foam that helps your feet get less stress. The mid strike helps you hit in the middle of your foot instead of your hill. It helps you to wear less of your shoe down and helps with your posture as you run.
customer_reviews.author: hillbillycat

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am a female and I bought these mens shoes because I like the color better than the womens. This is my second pair of these shoes and I love them for running. I put about 30 miles or more week on them. The first pair went 600 miles. They have great cushion and a good fit. The knit fabric is great in the summer. I usually wear a size 9 in womens and bought 7.5 in mens and they fit great. For the price, they are really good running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Stormy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Well Made Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm a heavy guy and these shoes are noticeably durable and very comfortable for walking or workouts. Paid more than I usually do for shoes but these were worth it and I think they will last a long time. Skechers products are some of the best. I've purchased many different types of Skechers shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Todd S.

customer_reviews.title: The narrowest shoe I’ve tried on in recent years
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10.5 and my feet may be a little on the wider side, but I don’t need to wear wide shoes. These Sketchers were extremely narrow for me. The length was ok, but the width was way too tight for me.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Like that these have a little rubber on the sole.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight is all the craze with my XC kid, logging 9-12 miles a day he burns through the expensive, yet cheaply constructed, foam soled shoes very quickly. I like that these at least have some rubber on the sole and I am hoping that they will serve him a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: DCB

customer_reviews.title: These are the best damn shoes I've ever worn.
customer_reviews.text: I will include one important caveat -- this is coming from someone who tried to run in skate shoes before running in these, but the differences are incredible. They're extremely light, have great support and bounce to them, and they breath well due to the entire upper section being made of a heavy-duty knit material. I can actually run now! The only thing I will mention is that I wouldn't recommend these for really cold weather. The same material that allows them to breath also makes them not super insulated, but that's only a minor thing.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ride!
customer_reviews.text: Great fitting shoe and great ride. I am a fan of Hoka Clifton's and these give a similar ride but I feel are more comfortable and also much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: John Impey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the jogger scene. These shoes have helped me run with fun. They are super comfortable, the stack height was my main concern because of ankle issues in the past. The wide base of the shoe makes me feel confident. The ride of the shoe because of the foam is awesome. I don't feel super sore after a "long" run (3+miles) and they make me feel stronger. They have changed my opinion of running for sport/fun. The price is well below anything else in its class. Definitely worth a try if you are looking for a soft/responsive/light running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen McArthur

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent running shoe! I've worn many Skechers performance shoes over the last few years and this is the best combo of weight, cushioning, and performance. Just slightly narrow compared to previous Go Ride versions, but the stretchy knit upper works well. Looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This is my second pair
customer_reviews.text: Wore the first pair out after 2200 miles in 6 months on a manufacturing production line. Excellent shoe - very light, sturdy, stable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Incredible cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I have suffered from Plantar Fasciatis for some time. Went from New Balance to Asics Gel Kayano 24 running shoe. I decided to try this Sketcher, and am blown away. My foot is totally cushioned and supported properly. Very lightweight! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Harris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoes on paved/tarred surfaces
customer_reviews.text: More comfortable than my adidas pureboost and nike winflo 5's. Less stability though, but when running on even surfaces and gravel, I prefer to run in these. Unbelievable amount of cushioning. My favourite running shoe of the three. Fit and size is similar to my adidas pureboost. (11.5 US)
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised, this brand is the most comfortable shoe I’ve ever owned. I’ve always bought Nike or Adidas with Reebok’s and some others thrown in the mix, but the instant I put them on, I fell in love. This is my new brand for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gay

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, excellent fit and durability.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Go Run Ride 7, and just by saying that I would say that's approved! More than that, my first pair took me to a marathon, helping through my year of training and the 4 more intenses months of preparation. After running the race, it seems to be a brand new shoes. It has now 700km and it's perfect (ok, the sole is worn but it's as expected). I truly prefer using that without the insole, as it fits better and it doesn't compromise my performance. For me, this is a win win choice. It's light and beautiful. A great shoes to drive you to your goals
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and feel from what I have come to expect from sketchers. I've been buying these shoes for years now and they are the best for running around hospital floors and working out
customer_reviews.author: A. Landazuri

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Super tight fit. These shoes are tighter on my feet than eleven and a halfs. I've never owned a pair of 12.5 size shoes but I guess I'll have to "upgrade". They do look good though!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Sketchers running shoes rock!!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5 and the 1st pair was tight, so I replaced them with a 11 and they fit great. I recommend go a size bigger if you’re looking at getting these great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Top dog

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and great performance.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this brand for the last 6 years, and I'm very happy with the quality, style and performance. I've tried other brands, but Skechers is the one that does it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador

customer_reviews.title: Cushy stable running shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes replaced an older pair of Sketchers running shoes and wore well from day one. All Sketchers seem to run small, but after you figure out the right size for you, buying a replacement is easy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Hoka Clifton
customer_reviews.text: Have been running in the Hoka Cliftons and decided to give these a chance. Despite never owning a pair of skechers in my life. I'm beyond pleasantly surprised. I'll never spend on another pair of Hokas again. These things do everything the Cliftons do - just better. My only complaint is the stability. The upper is so comfortable, its actually a detriment to stability. So don't anticipate making hard turns routinely. But beyond that, its a very fine running shoe if you're looking for a Clifton alternative.
customer_reviews.author: William Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Like walking on a cloud, just feels so good walking in them. I’ve mostly bought Asics for the last few years but these are so much more comfortable, time will tell if they hold up to running.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Scruggs

customer_reviews.title: A little tight around the toes (for me).
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn them once and they started off being very comfortable. However, as the day went on and the steps got over 10,000 I felt like they were a little tight up by my toes. I'll wear them again and make sure I don't cinch them as tight. I typically buy wider shoes, but I didn't have a choice with these. I really like the looks of them.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying the ride
customer_reviews.text: It is early days still but I am thoroughly enjoying the ride. I am a heavy sweater and truly hope that they can withstanding the flooding that they have to undergo after every run (4 times a week), without unsticking. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Active runner

customer_reviews.title: Good Value but needs more forefoot cushioning.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoes since I'm familiar with them. Are they perfect, hardly but for the price they work better than most shoes that cost substantially higher. If they really wanted to improve the shoe and I know there's a newer version, need better inner forefoot cushioning. The heel cushioning is very good but like everyone else that makes running shoes, forefoot cushioning is compromised and inadequate for running.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lee

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Had to return one pair get larger size. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate comfort
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is extremely comfortable, the curvature in the under sole rolls as you walk and soft on impact with the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Time to take Skechers Performance Seriously: GREAT RUNNING SHOE
customer_reviews.text: Great Running shoe, well cushioned still flexible enough. Compare to other shoe I currently have and some I had in the past I will have to say this is probably one of the best (Maybe in my top 3). I run on the HOKA One One Hupana (My Absolute favorites), Saucony Kinvara, Saucony Zealots, Hoka One One Clifton. This are for me Between the Hupana and the Zealots in term of how they perform. I like how the knit wrap around the foot. Overall this is a great shoe that look good and feels good, ESPECIALLY For the PRICE!
customer_reviews.author: Rodney G.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Responsive
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected. I wear a size 12 ordered a size 12 perfect fit. Very pleased with the comfort and quality of this shoe. Comfortable yet responsive. Have to admit I was skeptical of Sketchers but this shoe delivers.
customer_reviews.author: owen lindley

customer_reviews.title: Well made shoe, just not for me.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are well made, light and promising. They're not for me, or my son. I ran with them twice, both time my left ankle hurt after. My son used them and the same thing happened. I chalk it up to our body is different. They worth testing for yourself. 4 stars because I feel like it's a good shoe and will suit many just fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Parker

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably good for the price. Fixes everything I disliked about Cliftons, responds to almost any pace, and I love the upper.
customer_reviews.author: MSR

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, well cushioned
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a well cushioned shoe since I had a foot injury and it was uncomfortable to play tennis. I limped to accommodate my foot. This shoe solved that problem.
customer_reviews.author: William Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Great Marathon shoe!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just ran the 2019 Boston Marathon in this shoe, and over 200 training miles. An amazing ride! Boston 2019 was the first marathon I ran where did not crush my feet and toes with blisters. Good bye Nike Vapor Fly, Adidas!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Women’s size?
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great! But seller what the heck? On one part of the box the size is 11 but under the label it says (Mens size 9) I’ve previously bought these shoes before and know a men’s size 11 fits perfect. These have to be women’s shoes
customer_reviews.author: SouthSide

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Shoe experience confirms what many have already stated, regarding quality and ride. Pleased with the purchase. Well worth buying the 'used' option, through warehouse deals. They're brand new, perhaps worn in a house for a day. Save a good chunk of money.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleTyler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Wow- from the minute I put these on this morning, I knew I would like them. I work on my feet all day and these are like walking on foam.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: no half sizes after 10
customer_reviews.text: i would have given this product 5 stars if sketchers made them with a 12.5.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I am a consistent and experienced runner. I mainly run in Saucony and Brooks. I also own about 5 pairs of the sketchers 7 because they are that good.
customer_reviews.author: Art A

customer_reviews.title: comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a recreational runner (run between 10 to 14 miles per week). Tried them yesterday, 3.2 miles and they feel AWESOME on my feet! Comfortable, true to size, and seem to be durable! Excited to get on the pavement again with them!
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Selitto

customer_reviews.title: Excellent long distance runners
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoe I’ve worn. Great for marathons that I’ve done. Only negative is that the outsole doesn’t last as long as other runners I’ve worn. Expect 200-350 miles versus 400-500 for other brands.
customer_reviews.author: WC

customer_reviews.title: Pay new shoes and get used ones.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered them for delivery in the European Union as size 7.5 was not available in Europe, waited for the overseas delivery, paid customs duties on them only to discover that the "new" shoes had dirt between the tracks of the outersole, dirt spots on the midsole... like any proper used shoes. The shoes look good but the overall experience of paying for new shoes and receiving used ones was very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Popa

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair of running shoes Very comfortable Lasts about 250 to 300 miles of running
customer_reviews.author: Joe D. Bianchi

customer_reviews.title: Very best running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: By far the best pair of running shoes I have owned. The cushion is great and each step is responsive. Just finished 3.5 mile run. Excellent shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen H.

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: comfy and feels like the shoes are pushing you to walk more
customer_reviews.author: d7mo0on

customer_reviews.title: Work horse shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I run 50 miles a week. Usually I run in Hoka One One or New Balance. This shoe is a work horse, it can go any distance. For $40 - $60 This is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: manuel

customer_reviews.title: Dad shoe life
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look a little "dad life" but WTH cares - they are SO comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoe. One of my all time favorite running shoes. This is my second pair, the first was very durable. I got well I've 500 miles on them. Good daily trainer and a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is fantastic, even compared to shoes twice the price. I love the SGR7!
customer_reviews.author: L. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Toe box too small
customer_reviews.text: The mesh material pushed down on my big toe. Toe box too small on second pair even after going up a half a size... Ugh! The rest of the shoe felt great!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were ok. Definitely not worth close to $100.00. For my foot they were about at least 1/2 size too small. I’ve several pairs sketchers. Love all of them. Also I’ll not be buying from third parties in the future. A bit too convoluted when shipping and returning.
customer_reviews.author: George Elson

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These running sneakers are really comfortable. Like most sketchers they are light weight and have the air foam cushioning. They fit true to size. I’m not sure how they will do on long distance but I like them the for gym.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Geberth

customer_reviews.title: One of the best, if not, the best running shoe I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive. Super light. Breathable. Bouncy. Cushioned. Amazing. Runs like my Clifton 1.
customer_reviews.author: ridere46

customer_reviews.title: Tongue
customer_reviews.text: The shoe tongue ripped the third time I wore them. Unfortunately I was on vacation and could not return them immediately. Now the return window is closed. Other than the rip I like the shoes. This is my 3rd pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very light shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 9.5 instead of size 10- which would have been a better fit due to the insole insert- fits better without it- just not as cushiony!
customer_reviews.author: Mttnyc

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered both this and the GOrun 6 in 10.5 and the difference is ridiculous. The GORun 6's is a little narrow but normal length. The Ride 7s however are both super narrow and way too short so have to return.
customer_reviews.author: J. Something

customer_reviews.title: Cushion vs Return
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to leave the sock liner in for long runs, providing more cushion. Ill order a half size up next time. However they perform really well without it also.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A Collinsworth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to return for a full refund
customer_reviews.text: Tongue on really irritated the top of my foot and I had to send them back. Easy to return for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: fundevil

customer_reviews.title: Fits too small
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get to go for a run with it as I had to return. Apparently very comfortable but too small.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Camargo

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great fitting and cushioned running shoe. Just received them and have only done a few miles but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Order a 1/2 size larger.
customer_reviews.text: Fit about 1/2 size too small. Ordered a size 14 and they are a little short. Very comfortable though.
customer_reviews.author: Randy F. Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: im wearing a 9 & half toe box is pretty spacey if you take out the extra insole
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: N/A
customer_reviews.text: The sneaker itself is great. One thing bothered me. I could not tell that it was embroidered “Los Angeles” on the back heel. I’ll keep the sneakers, but I would not have bought them if I had noticed that. I’m from the Boston area. Get the picture!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very well cushioned. I am very heavy and its like walking on your bed bare foot.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Cuic

customer_reviews.title: Great value, put this shoe in your rotation
customer_reviews.text: A great, inexpensive daily trainer. It’s soft yet responsive, striking the perfect balance for long, slow runs and runs at faster tempos.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A Amundson

customer_reviews.title: Light
customer_reviews.text: Light and best cushioning but a little off for stability for sprint work.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Whiteside

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Love Skechers and these shoes didn’t disappoint. Seemed about half a size big compared to other Skechers I wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good for medium distance
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i was looking for and not wanting to spend over hundred and change
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: Size up if you buy
customer_reviews.text: I liked the shoe but it was way too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Daily Trainer. Would definitely recommend people to try this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: David Cecchi

customer_reviews.title: Its OK fits good
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is too squishy for me I think I'm too heavy
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Zaballa

customer_reviews.title: RNs favorite shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best pair of shoes I have ever bought
customer_reviews.author: Norman Swope

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: I love my Skechers never said that about running shoes. Bought a half size bigger from what others have said and they fit. Best Buy for me in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mielcarek

customer_reviews.title: Decent running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Felt uncomfortable when I first bought it. Now it's great! Decent pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Arjun

product_meta.title: Skechers Men's Go Run Ride 7 Shoe
product_meta.description: Space dyed air mesh neutral running shoe
feature_bullets: Ultra lightweight and responsive Flight Gen cushioning
Breathable two-toned knit upper with gusseted tongue for a comfortable and secure fit
Rubber traction outsole plate for durability
